intro: Octomeria sarcophylla, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and striking plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It is characterized by its unique, waxy, and often ghostly white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a short, fleshy stem and produces small, rounded leaves that are adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are typically borne in clusters and are pollinated by insects, particularly moths. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Octomeria sarcophylla is considered a vulnerable species.
